column4: oshix, can you please help me in understanding some instructions?
someone please help me
i cannot understand some instructions
ask your question.  If someone can help, they will.  Don't ask to ask a question.
I cannot understand the instructions here http://sampbar.com/2009/04/broadcom-bcm4318-ubuntu-intrepid/
maybe  could answer a specific question, if you have one.  I never use ndiswrapper.  I think it is a bad idea.  I'd go get a better wireless card, that is really supported in Linux.
click on the icon in the top left and type a few characters of the command you want
how do I copy files to my home directory?
how are you trying to copy?
how do I copy to home?
for example, to copy a file from Downloads called  thisfile, do   cd ~   then cp Download/thisfile .
are you sure you gave the right syntax for copying?
it gave the message: cp: missing destination file operand after `Download/broadcom-wl-4.150.10.5.tar.bz2'
sure.  But your file may have a different name.  Do a man cp to get the syntax.  It is just cp source destination    at its basics.
you must have left of the . at the end.  . indicates the current directory.
I right clicked the files and asked to copy to home directory. but they were instead copied to home/username.
is there any other way to  copy these files? I am a new user and I can't understand your commands
In linux mint i think there was a way to open the home folder as the admin and then copy
Most people would call home/username their home directory.  You may not have permissions to copy to /home.  If you really mean /home, then do the cp as sudo.
probably.  Their are lots of ways to do it.  You can open a nautilus root shell, or use sudo , or open a root terminal shel;l and copy.
nothing has happened after following the instructions in the page. Let me restart and confirm
